title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, has died after being critically injured in the February 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, targeted his ex-wife and son during a high school hockey game in Pawtucket.
A GoFundMe has been initiated to support Ava Dorgan and a high school senior following the shooting tragedy.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons rescued Pixie the cat from a 50-foot tree after Rhode Island's record blizzard.
Pixie was stuck for nearly two days in the tree amid three feet of snow in East Providence.
Local authorities couldn't assist; Lyons climbed using a chicken wire fence for support.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins face a tight schedule, with 25 games in eight weeks ahead of the NHL playoffs.
The Bruins need to improve their penalty kill, which ranks 28th in the league, with a 76.4% success rate.
Uncertain trade deadline strategy for Bruins; focus on balancing playoff push and long-term prospects.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire erupted at MCI-Norfolk, Massachusetts' largest medium-security prison, leading to a response from the Norfolk Fire Department.
Three incarcerated individuals received treatment for smoke inhalation; a staff member went to the hospital as a precaution.
Officials are assessing the damage and investigating the fire's cause, which remains unknown as of now.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown for NBA MVP due to his performance and impact on the Boston Celtics.
Despite losing key players, the Celtics hold second place in the East with a 38-19 record this season.
Jaylen Brown is averaging 29.2 points per game, stepping up in Jayson Tatum's absence due to injury.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard Professor Martin Nowak was placed on leave pending an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to Harvard's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics, run by Nowak, supporting his move from Princeton.
Nowak visited Epstein's private island in 2013 and facilitated Epstein's access to Harvard offices, as revealed by DOJ documents.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator and girls' basketball coach Scott Marino was charged with rape and indecent assault on a high school student.
Marino faces charges including two counts of rape, assault and battery, and selling liquor to a minor, according to court records.
Malden Public Schools placed Marino on leave immediately after the allegations and investigation notification from police.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing in a spring-training game against the Pirates, creating a viral moment.
The unusual incident left Abreu confused, as he had felt something odd with the bat in an earlier at-bat.
Despite the mishap, the Red Sox are optimistic about Abreu's performance, following his 22 home-run season despite injury.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource expects full power restoration by midnight Friday for remaining 160,000 outages in Eastern Massachusetts after Monday's blizzard.
Cape Cod and Martha’s Vineyard have 121,000 without power; Plymouth and New Bedford have 40,000 as of Wednesday morning.
Workers from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio assist in restoration efforts, with crews working 18-hour shifts, says Doug Foley.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA captain Hilary Knight criticized President Trump's joke about the women's hockey team as overshadowing their Olympic success.
The U.S. women's hockey team declined Trump's invitation to the State of the Union, citing prior commitments.
U.S. men's hockey player Jeremy Swayman expressed regret over the men's team reaction to Trump's comments.
